container.heading: Right of Voters to Vote by Mail

section.heading: Short Title
section.text: This chapter shall be known as the "The Right of Kiowa Voters to Vote by Mail Act of 2022" ("Act").

section.heading: Purpose
section.text: The purpose of this chapter is to authorize the Kiowa Election Commission to mail out ballots in all elections to all adult members of the Kiowa Tribe who maintain a current address to the Tribe, notwithstanding any law, ordinance, or resolution of the Tribe to the contrary and/or previously enacted by the Tribe.

para.text: Right of all adult Kiowa Tribal Members to vote is a fundamental component of democracy.
Fair and impartial elections are critical to guarantee the peoples right to choose their representation and to be governed by them.
In response to a recent BIA/CFR Court Order, the Legislature finds the need to solidify and guarantee the right of all Kiowa Tribal voters to receive a ballot by mail to all elections.

The Legislature hereby authorizes and directs the Kiowa Tribe Election Commission to mail out ballots to all adult members of the Kiowa Tribe who maintain a current address with the Tribe in all elections, notwithstanding any law, ordinance, or resolution of the Tribe to the contrary and/or previously enacted by the Tribe.
